member.name: T:Ion.Core.Toolkit.Foundation.MenuDescriptors.IMenuEntryPointProvider
member.summary: Each component (Table, Chart etc) which wants to support the agnostic Menu API must expose this interface to the outside world ("clients" from now on). Regardless of the actual menu structure of the component, clients can only ask for predefined , identified by a string. These entry points must have been registered by the component itself beforehand. Each Entry Point returned by the method is private to the caller. This means that a client can only see its own menu structure. The infrastructure will take care of merging all the entry points instances related to the same name and produce a single coherent menu structure.

member.name: M:Ion.Core.Toolkit.Foundation.MenuDescriptors.IMenuEntryPointProvider.CreateEntryPoint(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new entry point for the menu identified by the specified .
member.returns: An instance of , if the specified menu exists. null otherwise.
